page.title: 12"WOOTTON WAWEN" : Derivation
page.content:
Written reference to {Wootton {Wawen}is first found in a charter in the reign of {Aethelbald}who became king of Mercia in 716. The charter granted twenty hides of land for a monastery at{UUIDUTUUN}near a river called the {AELUUINNAE,}today's River Alne.
"UUIDU" (later "Wudu") meant a wood; "TUUN" (or "Tun") meant an enclosed piece of land with houses. A Saxon, called {WAGEN}held this land until the Norman Conquest, adding his own name to the original.
The name{WAGENES-WITONA }is found in writings dated 1138.
